entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued April 20 at 9:58AM AST until April 22 at 6:00AM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Eastern-most beaches of St. Croix. * WHEN...Through late Thursday night.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued April 20 at 3:28AM MDT until April 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Montana. Portions of north central Wyoming.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued April 20 at 2:39AM MDT until April 24 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG SPRING STORM POSSIBLE THIS WEEKEND... .A robust spring storm developing over the northern Plains late this week may bring heavy snow accumulations and strong winds to portions of northeastern Wyoming and northwestern South Dakota, including the Black Hills, this weekend. Snow accumulations over 6 inches and northwest wind gusts up to 60 mph will be possible
